mp_game_engine module¶

Engine for the two-player version of the game played through the command line.

mp_game_engine.advanced_ai_attack(coords: tuple[int, int], board: list[list[str]], ships: dict[str, int], hunt: list[dict[str, tuple[int, int], tuple[int, int], tuple[int, int]]], difficulty: [<class 'str'>]) → list[dict[str, tuple[int, int], tuple[int, int], tuple[int, int]]]¶

Replaces the ‘attack’ function for the more advanced AI.

Parameters:

  • coords (tuple) – the square being attacked.

  • board (list) – the board being attacked.

  • ships (dict) – the ships of the player being attacked.

  • hunt (list) – the list of ships that have been found by the AI

Returns:

the list of ships which have been found but not sunk

Return type:

list

mp_game_engine.ai_opponent_game_loop() → None¶

Ai game loop. takes nothing and returns nothing.

mp_game_engine.choose_advanced_square(ai_checked: list[tuple[int, int]], ships: dict[str, int], polarity: int, size: int) → tuple[int, int]¶

chooses a square based on the probability of the square being able to contain each ship.

Parameters:

  • ai_checked (list) – list of squares the ai has already attacked

  • ships (dict) – the player’s ships

  • polarity (int) – the distance between squares that the ai can check

  • size (int) – the size of the board

Returns:

the square that the ai chooses

Return type:

tuple

mp_game_engine.choose_square(ai_checked: list[tuple[int, int]], polarity: int, size: int) → tuple[int, int]¶

Chooses square randomly. separate implementation for the more advanced ai since the parameters for the generate_attack function are specified in the specification.

Parameters:

  • ai_checked (list) – the squares that the ai has already attacked.

  • polarity (int) – the polarity that the ai attacks with.

  • size (int) – the size of the board.

Returns:

the square chosen.

Return type:

tuple

mp_game_engine.generate_advanced_attack(ai_checked: list[tuple[int, int]], difficulty: str, hunt: list[dict[str, tuple[int, int], tuple[int, int], tuple[int, int]]], ships: dict[str, int], size: int)¶

Replaces the ‘generate_attack’ function for the more advanced AI

Parameters:

  • ai_checked (list) – the list of squares that the AI has checked

  • difficulty (string) – the difficulty of the game

  • hunt (list) – the list of ships that the AI has found

  • ships (dict) – the ships of the player being attacked

  • size (int) – the size of the board.

Returns:

the square generated by the AI, the list of squares that the AI has checked

Return type:

tuple, list

mp_game_engine.generate_attack(size: int = 10) → tuple[int, int]¶

Chooses square randomly.

Parameters:

size (int) – the size of the board.

Returns:

the generated square.

Return type:

tuple

mp_game_engine.validate_config_data(difficulty, size) -> (<class 'str'>, <class 'int'>)¶

Validates the data in config.json.

Parameters:

  • difficulty – the difficulty variable in config.json

  • size – the size variable in config.json

ECM1400 battleships
